byline.contributor: Jonathan Martin contributed reporting from Peterborough, N.H.
byline.original: By SHERYL GAY STOLBERG and STEVE EDER

abstract: Republican presidential candidate Ohio Gov John R Kasich paints himself as growing up solidly working-class from poor Pennsylvania family, but he spent almost eight years as investment banker with Lehman Brothers; he is seen as possible favorite of establishment Republicans if he moves away from his Wall Street ties.
lead_paragraph: A chapter in Mr. Kasich’s life story conflicts with the narrative about his working-class past: the nearly eight years he spent as an investment banker with Lehman Brothers.

headline.main: John Kasich Balances His Blue-Collar Roots and Ties to Wall Street
headline.print_headline: Kasich Fuses Wall St. Ties to Gritty Past

snippet: A chapter in Mr. Kasich’s life story conflicts with the narrative about his working-class past: the nearly eight years he spent as an investment banker with Lehman Brothers.
